text: [She seems curious. I'll tell her about our unique insects.] Well, there's the Rocking-horse-fly. It's made entirely of wood and gets about by swinging from branch to branch.
Sap and sawdust. (pauses) Shall I tell you about more insects?
There's the Snap-dragon-fly. Its body is made of plum-pudding, its wings of holly-leaves, and its head is a raisin burning in brandy.
Frumenty and mince-pie. And it makes its nest in a Christmas-box.
Yes, there's the Bread-and-butter-fly. Its wings are thin slices of bread-and-butter, its body is a crust, and its head is a lump of sugar.
Weak tea with cream in it.
